issue.title: Should SendToBaseStation() return false in case of delivery failure?

content.raw: You won't get a confirmation of message receipt, which is similar to how UDP works. The return value of true means that the message was sent, and does not indicate that the message was delivered.
content.html: You won't get a confirmation of message receipt, which is similar to how UDP works. The return value of true means that the message was sent, and does not indicate that the message was delivered.

issue.title: Should SendToBaseStation() return false in case of delivery failure?

content.raw: OK, thanks - how can we verify that the message was received by Base Station? If there is no feedback and transmitting the position twice takes points then only (?) "safe" way is to return to the tunnel entry and transmit very close to the Base Station??
content.html: OK, thanks - how can we verify that the message was received by Base Station? If there is no feedback and transmitting the position twice takes points then only (?) "safe" way is to return to the tunnel entry and transmit very close to the Base Station??

issue.title: Should SendToBaseStation() return false in case of delivery failure?

content.raw:
Maybe an alternative solution would be 5th "virtual robot"/"virtual operator", which could not move and would be placed in the base station. Then the communication with the other robots would be the same (potentially two way, checking proximity etc) and send to scoring machine would be guaranteed. This is actually more close to System Track where the operator (here virtual one) is connected via Ethernet and forwards (and filters) the results to DARPA server ...

we may experiment with this setup 3 + 1 static robot.
content.html:
Maybe an alternative solution would be 5th "virtual robot"/"virtual operator", which could not move and would be placed in the base station. Then the communication with the other robots would be the same (potentially two way, checking proximity etc) and send to scoring machine would be guaranteed. This is actually more close to System Track where the operator (here virtual one) is connected via Ethernet and forwards (and filters) the results to DARPA server ...

we may experiment with this setup 3 + 1 static robot.

issue.title: Should SendToBaseStation() return false in case of delivery failure?

content.raw: The base station will soon send an ACK according to section 5 of https://subtchallenge.com/resources/STIX_Interface_Control_Document.pdf.
content.html: The base station will soon send an ACK according to section 5 of https://subtchallenge.com/resources/STIX_Interface_Control_Document.pdf.

issue.title: Should SendToBaseStation() return false in case of delivery failure?
Should SendToBaseStation() return false in case of delivery failure?

content.raw: The acknowledgements are being sent. Your robots should be able to get these when sending score reports.  Please reopen if you see any problems.
content.html: The acknowledgements are being sent. Your robots should be able to get these when sending score reports. Please reopen if you see any problems.

issue.title: Should SendToBaseStation() return false in case of delivery failure?

content.raw: Can you update the SubT API page to include information about how we interact with the acknowledgements through the comms client? Are we still using the SendTo function with the base station address to report artifacts or do we have to use the JSON-based API in the STIX ICD now?
content.html: Can you update the SubT API page to include information about how we interact with the acknowledgements through the comms client? Are we still using the SendTo function with the base station address to report artifacts or do we have to use the JSON-based API in the STIX ICD now?

issue.title: Should SendToBaseStation() return false in case of delivery failure?

content.html:
I have a similar question like @Sarah Kitchen . Is the sample shown in score.cc still valid? I am able to read the ack like this, but the ack.report_status shows random characters, so I am guessing the interface changed. 

 subt::msgs::ArtifactScore ack;
    if (!ack.ParseFromString(_data))
    {
      ROS_INFO("Error parsing artifact score response...");
    }
    else
    {
       ROS_INFO("Received Ack, trying to parse..."); // Parsing not right, cannot get Status yet (check)
       ROS_INFO("Report Num %d, artifact type %d, run number %d, Report Status %s, Score change %d ",
       ack.report_id(),
           ack.artifact().type(), 
       ack.run(),
           ack.report_status(),
       ack.score_change());
    }

In case it helps.

issue.title: Should SendToBaseStation() return false in case of delivery failure?
Should SendToBaseStation() return false in case of delivery failure?

content.raw:
Hector, Sarah, we have updated the API wiki page with information about the base station ACK:

_“When a robot communicates with the base station, received artifact requests are acknowledged by sending back a message of type_ [_ArtifactScore_](#!/osrf/subt/src/default/subt_ign/src/protobuf/artifact.proto)_. Keep in mind, that the ACK can also be lost as any other message sent. Repeated artifact requests \(a request is considered repeated when contains the same artifact type and position as a previously sent request\) do not count as new requests for scoring purposes. In other words, a team will not loose an extra token while retrying to send a previously reported artifact._

_You should be able to receive the ACKs automatically if you already call_ `Bind()`_. What you_'_ll probably need to add is an extra check to distinguish if the source address is the base station. If that_'_s the case you_'_ll know that the received message is an ACK from the base station. Then, you can unserialize the message and process it accordingly._"
content.html:
Hector, Sarah, we have updated the API wiki page with information about the base station ACK:

“When a robot communicates with the base station, received artifact requests are acknowledged by sending back a message of type ArtifactScore. Keep in mind, that the ACK can also be lost as any other message sent. Repeated artifact requests (a request is considered repeated when contains the same artifact type and position as a previously sent request) do not count as new requests for scoring purposes. In other words, a team will not loose an extra token while retrying to send a previously reported artifact.

You should be able to receive the ACKs automatically if you already call Bind(). What you'll probably need to add is an extra check to distinguish if the source address is the base station. If that's the case you'll know that the received message is an ACK from the base station. Then, you can unserialize the message and process it accordingly."
